org.microbean.configuration.spi

Class ConfigurationCoordinates

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.configuration.spi.AbstractConfiguration
      • org.microbean.configuration.spi.ConfigurationCoordinates
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Configuration

    public final class ConfigurationCoordinates
extends AbstractConfiguration
implements Serializable
    An AbstractConfiguration conceptually housing only the configuration property that returns a Map-convertible String representing configuration coordinates for the calling application.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    Configurations.getConfigurationCoordinates(), Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public final ConfigurationValue getValue(Map<String,String> ignoredConfigurationCoordinates,
                                         String name)
        Attempts to return a value for the System property named "configurationCoordinates".

        This method may return null.

        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Configuration
        Parameters:
        ignoredConfigurationCoordinates - a Map of configuration coordinates in effect for the request; effectively ignored since by definition this method will be returning a ConfigurationValue containing a String value representing a Map of configuration coordinates for the caller; may be null; not used by this implementation
        name - the name of the configuration property for which a value should be returned; may be null
        Returns:
        a ConfigurationValue representing the configuration coordinates to assign to the caller, or null
        See Also:
        ConfigurationValue

      • getNames

        public final Set<String> getNames()
        Returns a Set of the names of all ConfigurationValues that might be returned by this Configuration.

        This method never returns null.

        This implementation returns a Set with only the value of Configurations.CONFIGURATION_COORDINATES in it.

        Specified by:
        getNames in interface Configuration
        Returns:
        a non-null Set of names
